availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Donan (Munfordville, Kentucky, attorney and politician)

body.p: Hart County, Kentucky, soldier, attorney, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Henrietta Wood Donan. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hart County from 1857 to 1861. Attorney in Hart County, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Hart County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Munfordville, p. 954.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District 2, p. 138B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Munfordville, p. 345B.
"Veteran of Mexican War Dies at Munfordville," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), April 27, 1905, p. 7.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. II (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1874), p. 332.
"John Gillaspy Donan (1826-1905)," Find A Grave, Memorial 158841799, accessed August 29, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/158841799.
